alert.note: Alert for Okeechobee; St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 15 at 8:52PM EST until January 16 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Martin, Okeechobee and St. Lucie. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 851 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Port Saint Lucie, Walton, Fort Pierce, Stuart, White City, Palm City, Jensen Beach, Saint Lucie Nuclear Power Plant, Sewall`s Point, Tradition, Saint Lucie West, Port Saint Lucie River Park, North River Shores, Indian River Estates, Fort Pierce South, Nettles Island, Ocean Breeze Park, Tradition Field, Carlton and Collins Park Estates. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
